/**
 * Eleventy Configuration
 * Properties 4 Creations - Veteran Housing Platform
 */

module.exports = function  (eleventyConfig) {
  // Passthrough copy for static assets from src
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/css": "css" });
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/js": "js" });
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/videos": "videos" });
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/manifest.json": "manifest.json" });
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/sw.js": "sw.js" });
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/search-index.json": "search-index.json" });
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/_data": "_data" });
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/_includes": "_includes" });
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/design-system": "design-system" });
  
  
  // Copy public folder assets (images, etc) to root
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/images": "images" });


  // Copy root files needed for GitHub Pages
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy("CNAME");
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy(".nojekyll");

  // Watch targets for development
  eleventyConfig.addWatchTarget("src/css/");
  eleventyConfig.addWatchTarget("src/js/");

  // Add date filters
  eleventyConfig.addFilter("dateFormat", (date) => {
    return new Date(date).toLocaleDateString('en-US', {
      year: 'numeric',
      month: 'long',
      day: 'numeric'
    });
  });

  // Add truncate filter for descriptions
  eleventyConfig.addFilter("truncate", (str, length = 120) => {
    if (!str) return '';
    if (str.length <= length) return str;
    return str.substring(0, length) + '...';
  });

  // Browser sync config for development
  eleventyConfig.setBrowserSyncConfig({
    files: ['docs/**/*'],
    open: true,
    notify: false
  });

  return {
    dir: {
      input: "src",
      output: "docs",
      includes: "_includes",
      data: "_data"
    },
    templateFormats: ["html", "njk", "md"],
    htmlTemplateEngine: "njk",
    markdownTemplateEngine: "njk"
  };
};

FILE: .github\workflows\build-deploy.yml
SIZE: 1748 bytes
MODIFIED: 2025-12-16 03:08:30
================================================================================
name: Build and Deploy

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, master ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main, master ]

permissions:
  contents: write
  pages: write
  id-token: write

jobs:
  lint:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Setup Node.js
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: '18'
        cache: 'npm'
        
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci
      
    - name: Run ESLint
      run: npm run lint

  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: lint
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Setup Node.js
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: '18'
        cache: 'npm'
        
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci
      
    - name: Build site
      run: npm run build
      
    - name: Upload build artifacts
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
      with:
        name: dist
        path: docs/

  deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Setup Node.js
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: '18'
        cache: 'npm'
        
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci
      
    - name: Build for production
      run: npm run build
      
    - name: Deploy to GitHub Pages
      uses: peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v3
      with:
        github_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
        publish_dir: ./docs

name: Comprehensive Testing & Quality Assurance

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main, develop ]

env:
  NODE_VERSION: '18'
  CI: true

jobs:
  code-quality:
    name: Code Quality & Linting
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'npm'
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Run ESLint
        run: npm run lint
        
      - name: Check Prettier formatting
        run: npm run format:check
        
      - name: Security audit
        run: npm audit --audit-level moderate

  unit-tests:
    name: Unit Tests & Coverage
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: code-quality
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'npm'
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Run unit tests with coverage
        run: npm run test:coverage
        
      - name: Upload coverage reports
        uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
        with:
          file: ./coverage/lcov.info
          flags: unittests
          name: codecov-umbrella

  integration-tests:
    name: Integration Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: unit-tests
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'npm'
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Build site
        run: npm run build
        
      - name: Start development server
        run: |
          npm run dev &
          sleep 10
          
      - name: Run integration tests
        run: npm run test -- tests/integration/
        
      - name: Upload integration test results
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
        if: failure()
        with:
          name: integration-test-results
          path: |
            tests/integration-results/
            test-results/

  accessibility-tests:
    name: Accessibility Testing
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: unit-tests
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'npm'
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Build site
        run: npm run build
        
      - name: Start development server
        run: |
          npm run dev &
          sleep 10
          
      - name: Run accessibility tests with axe-core
        run: |
          npx playwright test tests/e2e/ --grep="Accessibility|accessibility" --reporter=html
          
      - name: Upload accessibility test results
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
        if: always()
        with:
          name: accessibility-test-results
          path: |
            test-results/
            playwright-report/

  e2e-tests:
    name: End-to-End Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: unit-tests
    
    strategy:
      matrix:
        browser: [chromium, firefox, webkit]
        
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'npm'
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Build site
        run: npm run build
        
      - name: Install Playwright browsers
        run: npx playwright install ${{ matrix.browser }} --with-deps
        
      - name: Start development server
        run: |
          npm run dev &
          sleep 10
          
      - name: Run Playwright tests
        run: npx playwright test --project=${{ matrix.browser }}
        
      - name: Upload Playwright Report
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
        if: always()
        with:
          name: playwright-report-${{ matrix.browser }}
          path: |
            playwright-report/
            test-results/

  lighthouse:
    name: Lighthouse Performance Audit
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: unit-tests
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'npm'
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Build site
        run: npm run build
        
      - name: Install LHCI
        run: npm install -g @lhci/cli@0.12.x
        
      - name: Start development server
        run: |
          npm run dev &
          sleep 10
          
      - name: Run Lighthouse CI
        run: lhci autorun
        env:
          LHCI_GITHUB_APP_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.LHCI_GITHUB_APP_TOKEN }}
          
      - name: Upload Lighthouse reports
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
        if: always()
        with:
          name: lighthouse-reports
          path: |
            .lighthouseci/
            reports/

  cross-browser-tests:
    name: Cross-Browser Compatibility
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: unit-tests
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'npm'
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Build site
        run: npm run build
        
      - name: Install Playwright browsers
        run: npx playwright install --with-deps
        
      - name: Start development server
        run: |
          npm run dev &
          sleep 10

  quality-gate:
    name: Quality Gate
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [unit-tests, integration-tests, e2e-tests, lighthouse, security-tests]
    if: always()
    
    steps:
      - name: Check test results
        run: |
          if [[ "${{ needs.unit-tests.result }}" == "failure" ]]; then
            echo "Unit tests failed"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          if [[ "${{ needs.integration-tests.result }}" == "failure" ]]; then
            echo "Integration tests failed"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          if [[ "${{ needs.e2e-tests.result }}" == "failure" ]]; then
            echo "E2E tests failed"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          if [[ "${{ needs.lighthouse.result }}" == "failure" ]]; then
            echo "Lighthouse tests failed"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          if [[ "${{ needs.security-tests.result }}" == "failure" ]]; then
            echo "Security tests failed"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          echo "All tests passed successfully!"
          
      - name: Post success comment
        if: github.event_name == 'pull_request'
        uses: actions/github-script@v6
        with:
          script: |
            github.rest.issues.createComment({
              issue_number: context.issue.number,
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              body: 'ðŸŽ‰ All tests passed successfully! The code is ready for review and deployment.'
            })

  performance-regression:
    name: Performance Regression Detection
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [build-and-deploy]
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        
      - name: Setup Node.js

        with:
          script: |
            // This would typically fetch and comment on performance metrics
            console.log('Performance regression check completed');

FILE: .github\workflows\deploy.yml
SIZE: 1089 bytes
MODIFIED: 2025-12-18 22:07:46
================================================================================
name: Deploy to GitHub Pages

on:
  push:
    branches: [ 'main' ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ 'main' ]

permissions:
  contents: read
  pages: write
  id-token: write

concurrency:
  group: 'pages'
  cancel-in-progress: false

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Setup Node.js
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: '18'
        cache: 'npm'
        
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci
      
    - name: Build site
      run: npm run build
      
    - name: Setup Pages
      uses: actions/configure-pages@v4
      
    - name: Upload artifact
      uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
      with:
        path: './docs'

  deploy:
    needs: build
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    environment:
      name: github-pages
      url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}
    
    steps:
    - name: Deploy to GitHub Pages
      id: deployment
      uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4

FILE: .eleventy.js

/**
 * Eleventy Configuration
 * Properties 4 Creations - Veteran Housing Platform
 */

module.exports = function  (eleventyConfig) {
  // Passthrough copy for static assets from src
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/css": "css" });
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/js": "js" });
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/videos": "videos" });
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/manifest.json": "manifest.json" });
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/sw.js": "sw.js" });
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/search-index.json": "search-index.json" });
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/_data": "_data" });
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/_includes": "_includes" });
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/design-system": "design-system" });
  
  
  // Copy public folder assets (images, etc) to root
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy({ "src/images": "images" });


  // Copy root files needed for GitHub Pages
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy("CNAME");
  eleventyConfig.addPassthroughCopy(".nojekyll");

  // Watch targets for development
  eleventyConfig.addWatchTarget("src/css/");
  eleventyConfig.addWatchTarget("src/js/");

  // Add date filters
  eleventyConfig.addFilter("dateFormat", (date) => {
    return new Date(date).toLocaleDateString('en-US', {
      year: 'numeric',
      month: 'long',
      day: 'numeric'
    });
  });

  // Add truncate filter for descriptions
  eleventyConfig.addFilter("truncate", (str, length = 120) => {
    if (!str) return '';
    if (str.length <= length) return str;
    return str.substring(0, length) + '...';
  });

  // Browser sync config for development
  eleventyConfig.setBrowserSyncConfig({
    files: ['docs/**/*'],
    open: true,
    notify: false
  });

  return {
    dir: {
      input: "src",
      output: "docs",
      includes: "_includes",
      data: "_data"
    },
    templateFormats: ["html", "njk", "md"],
    htmlTemplateEngine: "njk",
    markdownTemplateEngine: "njk"
  };
};

FILE: .github\workflows\build-deploy.yml
SIZE: 1748 bytes
MODIFIED: 2025-12-16 03:08:30
================================================================================
name: Build and Deploy

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, master ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main, master ]

permissions:
  contents: write
  pages: write
  id-token: write

jobs:
  lint:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Setup Node.js
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: '18'
        cache: 'npm'
        
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci
      
    - name: Run ESLint
      run: npm run lint

  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: lint
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Setup Node.js
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: '18'
        cache: 'npm'
        
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci
      
    - name: Build site
      run: npm run build
      
    - name: Upload build artifacts
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
      with:
        name: dist
        path: docs/

  deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Setup Node.js
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: '18'
        cache: 'npm'
        
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci
      
    - name: Build for production
      run: npm run build
      
    - name: Deploy to GitHub Pages
      uses: peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v3
      with:
        github_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
        publish_dir: ./docs

FILE: .github\workflows\comprehensive-testing.yml
SIZE: 13261 bytes
MODIFIED: 2025-12-15 14:33:35

name: Comprehensive Testing & Quality Assurance

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main, develop ]

env:
  NODE_VERSION: '18'
  CI: true

jobs:
  code-quality:
    name: Code Quality & Linting
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'npm'
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Run ESLint
        run: npm run lint
        
      - name: Check Prettier formatting
        run: npm run format:check
        
      - name: Security audit
        run: npm audit --audit-level moderate

  unit-tests:
    name: Unit Tests & Coverage
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: code-quality
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'npm'
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Run unit tests with coverage
        run: npm run test:coverage
        
      - name: Upload coverage reports
        uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
        with:
          file: ./coverage/lcov.info
          flags: unittests
          name: codecov-umbrella

  integration-tests:
    name: Integration Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: unit-tests
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'npm'
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Build site
        run: npm run build
        
      - name: Start development server
        run: |
          npm run dev &
          sleep 10
          
      - name: Run integration tests
        run: npm run test -- tests/integration/
        
      - name: Upload integration test results
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
        if: failure()
        with:
          name: integration-test-results
          path: |
            tests/integration-results/
            test-results/

  accessibility-tests:
    name: Accessibility Testing
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: unit-tests
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'npm'
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Build site
        run: npm run build
        
      - name: Start development server
        run: |
          npm run dev &
          sleep 10
          
      - name: Run accessibility tests with axe-core
        run: |
          npx playwright test tests/e2e/ --grep="Accessibility|accessibility" --reporter=html
          
      - name: Upload accessibility test results
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
        if: always()
        with:
          name: accessibility-test-results
          path: |
            test-results/
            playwright-report/

  e2e-tests:
    name: End-to-End Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: unit-tests
    
    strategy:
      matrix:
        browser: [chromium, firefox, webkit]
        
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'npm'
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Build site
        run: npm run build
        
      - name: Install Playwright browsers
        run: npx playwright install ${{ matrix.browser }} --with-deps
        
      - name: Start development server
        run: |
          npm run dev &
          sleep 10
          
      - name: Run Playwright tests
        run: npx playwright test --project=${{ matrix.browser }}
        
      - name: Upload Playwright Report
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
        if: always()
        with:
          name: playwright-report-${{ matrix.browser }}
          path: |
            playwright-report/
            test-results/

  lighthouse:
    name: Lighthouse Performance Audit
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: unit-tests
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'npm'
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Build site

  quality-gate:
    name: Quality Gate
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [unit-tests, integration-tests, e2e-tests, lighthouse, security-tests]
    if: always()
    
    steps:
      - name: Check test results
        run: |
          if [[ "${{ needs.unit-tests.result }}" == "failure" ]]; then
            echo "Unit tests failed"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          if [[ "${{ needs.integration-tests.result }}" == "failure" ]]; then
            echo "Integration tests failed"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          if [[ "${{ needs.e2e-tests.result }}" == "failure" ]]; then
            echo "E2E tests failed"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          if [[ "${{ needs.lighthouse.result }}" == "failure" ]]; then
            echo "Lighthouse tests failed"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          if [[ "${{ needs.security-tests.result }}" == "failure" ]]; then
            echo "Security tests failed"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          echo "All tests passed successfully!"
          
      - name: Post success comment
        if: github.event_name == 'pull_request'
        uses: actions/github-script@v6
        with:
          script: |
            github.rest.issues.createComment({
              issue_number: context.issue.number,
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              body: 'ðŸŽ‰ All tests passed successfully! The code is ready for review and deployment.'
            })

FILE: .github\workflows\deploy.yml
SIZE: 1089 bytes
MODIFIED: 2025-12-18 22:07:46
================================================================================
name: Deploy to GitHub Pages

on:
  push:
    branches: [ 'main' ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ 'main' ]

permissions:
  contents: read
  pages: write
  id-token: write

concurrency:
  group: 'pages'
  cancel-in-progress: false

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Setup Node.js
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: '18'
        cache: 'npm'
        
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci
      
    - name: Build site
      run: npm run build
      
    - name: Setup Pages
      uses: actions/configure-pages@v4
      
    - name: Upload artifact
      uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
      with:
        path: './docs'

  deploy:
    needs: build
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    environment:
      name: github-pages
      url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}
    
    steps:
    - name: Deploy to GitHub Pages
      id: deployment
      uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4

FILE: convert_to_text_enhanced.py
SIZE: 14297 bytes
MODIFIED: 2025-12-20 19:47:56

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Enhanced File Converter - Single File Output with Directory Exclusion
Converts source code files to append to a single .txt format file.

Features:
- Excludes node_modules, codeReview, .git, and .clinerules directories during scanning
- Outputs everything to one single text file (append mode)
- Command-line configurable source folder and output file
- Progress tracking with detailed output
- Enhanced error handling and reporting
- Configurable file extensions
- Statistics and summary reporting
- Windows-compatible (no emoji characters)
"""

import os
import sys
import argparse
from datetime import datetime
from pathlib import Path


class SingleFileConverter:
    '''Enhanced file converter with single file append output.'''
    
    def __init__(self, source_folder, output_file, extensions=None, exclude_extensions=None):
        self.source_folder = Path(source_folder)
        self.output_file = Path(output_file)
        self.extensions = extensions or ['.html', '.json', '.js', '.css', '.md', '.njk', '.txt', '.py', '.yml', '.yaml']
        self.exclude_extensions = exclude_extensions or ['.png', '.jpg', '.jpeg', '.gif', '.svg', '.mp4', '.webm', '.ico', '.woff', '.woff2']
        self.exclude_directories = ['node_modules', 'codeReview', '.git', '.clinerules']
        self.skipped_files = []
        self.error_files = []
        self.stats = {
            "total_files": 0,
            "converted": 0,
            "skipped": 0,
            "errors": 0,
            "total_chars": 0,
            "total_lines": 0
        }
        
    def should_convert_file(self, file_path):
        '''Determine if a file should be converted.'''
        # Check if file extension matches conversion criteria
        file_ext = file_path.suffix.lower()

        # Skip binary files
        if file_ext in self.exclude_extensions:
            return False, 'binary file'

        # Skip if extension not in conversion list
        if file_ext not in self.extensions:
            return False, 'unsupported extension'

        return True, None

    def generate_project_tree(self):
        '''Generate a text-based project tree excluding specified directories.'''
        tree_lines = []

        def add_tree(path, prefix=''):
            try:
                items = sorted(os.listdir(path))
            except PermissionError:
                return

            filtered_items = []
            for item in items:
                full_path = os.path.join(path, item)
                if os.path.isdir(full_path) and item in self.exclude_directories:
                    continue
                filtered_items.append(item)

            for i, item in enumerate(filtered_items):
                full_path = os.path.join(path, item)
                is_last = (i == len(filtered_items) - 1)
                connector = 'â””â”€â”€ ' if is_last else 'â”œâ”€â”€ '
                tree_lines.append(prefix + connector + item)

                if os.path.isdir(full_path):
                    extension = '    ' if is_last else 'â”‚   '
                    add_tree(full_path, prefix + extension)

        tree_lines.append('.')
        add_tree(str(self.source_folder))
        return '\n'.join(tree_lines)
        
    def format_file_separator(self, file_path, is_first=False):
        '''Create a formatted file separator.'''
        relative_path = file_path.relative_to(self.source_folder)
        separator = []
        
        if is_first:
            separator.append('=' * 80)
        else:
            separator.append('-' * 80)
            
        separator.append(f'FILE: {relative_path}')
        separator.append(f'SIZE: {file_path.stat().st_size:} bytes')
        separator.append(f'MODIFIED: {datetime.fromtimestamp(file_path.stat().st_mtime).strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}')
        separator.append('=' * 80)
        
        return '\n'.join(separator)
        
    def convert_and_append_file(self, file_path, is_first=False):
        '''Convert a single file and append to the output file.'''
        try:
            # Read file content with proper encoding handling
            try:
                with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
                    content = f.read()
            except UnicodeDecodeError:
                # Try with different encoding if UTF-8 fails
                with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='latin-1') as f:
                    content = f.read()
                    
            if not content.strip():
                return False, 'empty file'
                
            # Calculate stats
            lines = len(content.splitlines())
            chars = len(content)
            
            # Append to single output file
            with open(self.output_file, 'a', encoding='utf-8') as output:
                # Add file separator
                separator = self.format_file_separator(file_path, is_first)
                output.write(separator)
                output.write('\n')
                
                # Add file content
                output.write(content)
                output.write('\n\n')
                
            # Update stats
            self.stats['converted'] += 1
            self.stats['total_chars'] += chars
            self.stats['total_lines'] += lines
            
            return True, f'converted ({lines} lines, {chars} chars)'
            
        except Exception as e:
            self.stats['errors'] += 1
            error_msg = f'error: {str(e)}'
            self.error_files.append({"file": str(file_path), "error": error_msg})
            return False, error_msg
            
    def process_files(self):
        '''Process all files in the source directory, excluding specified directories.'''
        print(f'[SEARCH] Scanning source folder: {self.source_folder}')
        print(f'[EXCLUDE] Skipping directories: {', '.join(self.exclude_directories)}')
        print(f'[FILE] Looking for extensions: {', '.join(self.extensions)}')
        print(f'[SKIP] Excluding: {', '.join(self.exclude_extensions)}')
        print(f'[OUTPUT] Single file mode: {self.output_file}')
        print('-' * 60)
        
        # Clear the output file at start
        self.output_file.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
        with open(self.output_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
            f.write(f'CONSOLIDATED PROJECT FILES\n')
            f.write(f'Generated: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n')
            f.write(f'Source: {self.source_folder}\n')
            f.write(f'Output: {self.output_file}\n')
            f.write('=' * 80 + '\n\n')

            # Generate and append project tree
            project_tree = self.generate_project_tree()
            f.write('PROJECT TREE:\n')
            f.write(project_tree)
            f.write('\n\n' + '=' * 80 + '\n\n')
        
        # Get all files for processing (excluding specified directories)
        all_files = []
        for root, dirs, files in os.walk(self.source_folder):
            # Remove excluded directories from dirs to prevent walking into them
            dirs[:] = [d for d in dirs if d not in self.exclude_directories]
            
            root_path = Path(root)
            for file in files:
                file_path = root_path / file
                all_files.append(file_path)
        
        # Sort files for consistent ordering
        all_files.sort(key=lambda x: x.relative_to(self.source_folder))
        
        # Process each file
        for i, file_path in enumerate(all_files):
            self.stats['total_files'] += 1
            
            # Check if file should be converted
            should_convert, reason = self.should_convert_file(file_path)
            
            if should_convert:
                is_first = (self.stats['converted'] == 0)
                success, message = self.convert_and_append_file(file_path, is_first)
                if success:
                    print(f'[OK] {file_path.relative_to(self.source_folder)} -> {message}')
                else:
                    print(f'[FAIL] {file_path.relative_to(self.source_folder)} -> {message}')
                    self.skipped_files.append(str(file_path))
            else:
                print(f'[SKIP] {file_path.relative_to(self.source_folder)} -> skipped ({reason})')
                self.stats['skipped'] += 1
                self.skipped_files.append(str(file_path))
                
    def generate_summary_report(self):
        '''Generate detailed conversion summary.'''
        report_lines = []
        report_lines.append('=' * 80)
        report_lines.append('FILE CONVERSION SUMMARY REPORT')
        report_lines.append('=' * 80)
        report_lines.append(f'Generated: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}')
        report_lines.append(f'Source folder: {self.source_folder}')
        report_lines.append(f'Output file: {self.output_file}')
        report_lines.append(f'Excluded directories: {', '.join(self.exclude_directories)}')
        report_lines.append('')
        
        # Statistics
        report_lines.append('STATISTICS:')
        report_lines.append('-' * 40)
        report_lines.append(f'Total files scanned: {self.stats['total_files']}')
        report_lines.append(f'Files converted: {self.stats['converted']}')
        report_lines.append(f'Files skipped: {self.stats['skipped']}')
        report_lines.append(f'Errors: {self.stats['errors']}')
        report_lines.append(f'Total characters: {self.stats['total_chars']:}')
        report_lines.append(f'Total lines: {self.stats['total_lines']:}')
        report_lines.append('')
        
        # Skipped files
        if self.skipped_files:
            report_lines.append('SKIPPED FILES:')
            report_lines.append('-' * 40)
            for file_path in self.skipped_files:
                rel_path = Path(file_path).relative_to(self.source_folder)
                report_lines.append(f'{rel_path}')
            report_lines.append('')
            
        # Error files
        if self.error_files:
            report_lines.append('ERROR FILES:')
            report_lines.append('-' * 40)
            for error_info in self.error_files:
                rel_path = Path(error_info['file']).relative_to(self.source_folder)
                report_lines.append(f'{rel_path}: {error_info['error']}')
            report_lines.append('')
            
        report_lines.append('=' * 80)
        
        # Save summary report
        summary_path = self.output_file.parent / 'conversion_summary.txt'
        with open(summary_path, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
            f.write('\n'.join(report_lines))
            
        return summary_path, '\n'.join(report_lines)
        
    def run(self):
        '''Execute the conversion process.'''
        print('[START] Starting single-file conversion process')
        print('=' * 60)
        
        try:
            # Validate source folder
            if not self.source_folder.exists():
                print(f'[ERROR] Source folder does not exist: {self.source_folder}')
                return False
                
            # Process files
            self.process_files()
            
            # Generate summary report
            summary_path, summary_content = self.generate_summary_report()
            
            # Print summary
            print('\n' + '=' * 60)
            print('[SUCCESS] CONVERSION COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY!')
            print('=' * 60)
            print(f'[STATS] Summary:')
            print(f'   * Files converted: {self.stats['converted']}')
            print(f'   * Files skipped: {self.stats['skipped']}')
            print(f'   * Errors: {self.stats['errors']}')
            print(f'   * Total characters: {self.stats['total_chars']:}')
            print(f'   * Total lines: {self.stats['total_lines']:}')
            print(f'\n[FILE] Single output file: {self.output_file}')
            print(f'[SUMMARY] Report: {summary_path}')
            
            return True
            
        except Exception as e:
            print(f'[ERROR] Fatal error during conversion: {e}')
            return False


def main():
    '''Main function with command-line argument parsing.'''
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(
        description='Convert source code files to single .txt file (append mode).',
        formatter_class=argparse.RawDescriptionHelpFormatter,
    epilog="""
Examples:
  python convert_to_text_enhanced.py
  python convert_to_text_enhanced.py --source ./src --output ./all_code.txt
  python convert_to_text_enhanced.py --extensions .html,.js,.css --exclude .png,.jpg
        """
    )
    
    parser.add_argument(
        '--source', 
        default='.',
        help='Source folder to scan (default: current directory)'
    )
    
    parser.add_argument(
        '--output',
        default='consolidated_output.txt',
        help='Output file for all converted content (default: consolidated_output.txt)'
    )
    
    parser.add_argument(
        '--extensions',
        help='Comma-separated list of file extensions to convert (e.g., .html,.js,.css)'
    )
    
    parser.add_argument(
        '--exclude',
        help='Comma-separated list of file extensions to exclude (e.g., .png,.jpg,.gif)'
    )
    
    args = parser.parse_args()
    
    # Process extensions
    extensions = None
    if args.extensions:
        extensions = [ext.strip() for ext in args.extensions.split(',')]
        
    exclude_extensions = None
    if args.exclude:
        exclude_extensions = [ext.strip() for ext in args.exclude.split(',')]
    
    # Create converter and run
    converter = SingleFileConverter(
        source_folder=args.source,
        output_file=args.output,
        extensions=extensions,
        exclude_extensions=exclude_extensions
    )
    
    success = converter.run()
    sys.exit(0 if success else 1)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

        integrity="sha384-sha384-XcPm71GSOvViJoCA7WCb/9rSD/M3VBABxIZH30y7wbDtwRymtm2Dw2NTumuGrJqB"
        crossorigin="anonymous"></script>
    <script>
        lucide.createIcons();

    <script src="/js/main.js"></script>

    <script>
        // APPLICATION FORM JAVASCRIPT
        document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function () {
            const form = document.getElementById('application-form');
            const successMessage = document.getElementById('success-message');
            const applicantType = document.getElementById('applicant-type');
            const militaryGroup = document.getElementById('military-service-group');

            // Hide success message by default
            successMessage.style.display = 'none';

            // Show/hide military service field based on applicant type
            applicantType.addEventListener('change', function () {
                if (this.value === 'veteran' || this.value === 'spouse') {
                    militaryGroup.style.display = 'block';
                    document.getElementById('military-service').required = true;
                } else {
                    militaryGroup.style.display = 'none';
                    document.getElementById('military-service').required = false;
                }
            });

            form.addEventListener('submit', function (e) {
                e.preventDefault();

                let isValid = true;
                const formGroups = form.querySelectorAll('.form-group');

                formGroups.forEach(group => {
                    const input = group.querySelector('input, select, textarea');
                    const errorMessage = group.querySelector('.error-message');

                    if (input && input.hasAttribute('required') && !input.value.trim()) {
                        isValid = false;
                        errorMessage.style.display = 'block';
                        input.classList.add('error');
                    } else {
                        errorMessage.style.display = 'none';
                        input.classList.remove('error');
                    }

                    // Email validation
                    if (input && input.type === 'email' && input.value) {
                        const emailRegex = /^[^\s@]+@[^\s@]+\.[^\s@]+$/;
                        if (!emailRegex.test(input.value)) {
                            isValid = false;
                            errorMessage.textContent = 'Please enter a valid email address';
                            errorMessage.style.display = 'block';
                            input.classList.add('error');
                        }
                    }

                    // Phone validation
                    if (input && input.type === 'tel' && input.value) {
                        const phoneRegex = /^[0-9\-\+\(\)\s]+$/;
                        if (!phoneRegex.test(input.value)) {
                            isValid = false;
                            errorMessage.textContent = 'Please enter a valid phone number';
                            errorMessage.style.display = 'block';
                            input.classList.add('error');
                        }
                    }
                });

                if (isValid) {
                    // Here you would typically send the form data to a server
                    // For now, we'll just show the success message
                    successMessage.style.display = 'block';
                    form.reset();

                    // Scroll to success message
                    successMessage.scrollIntoView({ behavior: 'smooth' });
                }
            });
        });
    </script>
</body>

</html>

<h1>Design Principles - Properties 4 Creations</h1>
<h2>Overview</h2>
<p>This document outlines the design principles, visual language, and guidelines for the Properties 4 Creations housing platform serving <strong>families and veterans</strong> in East Texas. These principles ensure consistency, accessibility, and a professional user experience across all touchpoints.</p>
<hr>
<h2>Core Values</h2>
<h3>1. Family &amp; Veteran-First Design</h3>
<ul>
<li>Design with dignity, respect, and accessibility as primary concerns for all families and veterans</li>
<li>Use clear, straightforward language without jargon</li>
<li>Provide multiple pathways to complete tasks</li>
<li>Ensure all critical information is easily discoverable</li>
<li>Consider diverse family structures and needs</li>
<li>Honor veteran service while welcoming all eligible families</li>
</ul>
<h3>2. Transparency &amp; Trust</h3>
<ul>
<li>Clear information hierarchy with honest communication</li>
<li>No hidden fees, terms, or conditions</li>
<li>Progress indicators for multi-step processes</li>
<li>Consistent, predictable interface patterns</li>
</ul>
<h3>3. Accessibility (WCAG 2.2 AA)</h3>
<ul>
<li>Minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio for all text</li>
<li>44x44px minimum touch targets</li>
<li>Full keyboard navigation support</li>
<li>Screen reader compatibility</li>
<li>Respect user preferences (reduced motion, color scheme)</li>
</ul>
<h3>4. Performance</h3>
<ul>
<li>Core Web Vitals compliance (LCP &lt;2.5s, FID &lt;100ms, CLS &lt;0.1)</li>
<li>Progressive enhancement approach</li>
<li>Offline-first PWA capabilities</li>
<li>Optimized images and assets</li>
</ul>
<hr>
<h2>Visual Language</h2>
<h3>Color Palette</h3>
<h4>Primary Colors</h4>
<table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Color</th>
<th>Hex</th>
<th>Usage</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Navy</td>
<td><code>#0B1120</code></td>
<td>Brand, headers, CTAs, primary text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Gold</td>
<td><code>#C28E5A</code></td>
<td>Accents, highlights, interactive elements</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Beige</td>
<td><code>#F5F5F0</code></td>
<td>Backgrounds, cards</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h4>Semantic Colors</h4>
<table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Color</th>
<th>Hex</th>
<th>Usage</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Error</td>
<td><code>#D32F2F</code></td>
<td>Error states, destructive actions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Success</td>
<td><code>#388E3C</code></td>
<td>Success states, confirmations</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Warning</td>
<td><code>#F57C00</code></td>
<td>Warnings, cautions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Info</td>
<td><code>#1976D2</code></td>
<td>Informational messages</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h4>Neutral Colors</h4>
<ul>
<li>White (<code>#FFFFFF</code>) - Card backgrounds, text on dark</li>
<li>Gray scale (<code>#F9FAFB</code> to <code>#111827</code>) - Borders, secondary text, dividers</li>
<li>Black (<code>#000000</code>) - High contrast text when needed</li>
</ul>
<h3>Typography</h3>
<h4>Font Families</h4>
<ul>
<li><strong>Headings</strong>: Merriweather (serif) - Conveys trust and professionalism</li>
<li><strong>Body</strong>: System fonts (-apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto) - Optimal readability</li>
<li><strong>Code</strong>: Monaco, Courier New (monospace) - Technical content</li>
</ul>

<hr>
<h2>Component Guidelines</h2>
<h3>Buttons</h3>
<h4>Variants</h4>
<ol>
<li><strong>Primary</strong> - Main CTAs (gold background, navy text)</li>
<li><strong>Secondary</strong> - Secondary actions (navy outline)</li>
<li><strong>Tertiary</strong> - Low-emphasis actions (text only)</li>
<li><strong>Danger</strong> - Destructive actions (red)</li>
</ol>
<h4>States</h4>
<ul>
<li>Default, Hover, Active, Focus, Disabled, Loading</li>
</ul>
<h4>Sizing</h4>
<ul>
<li>Small: 36px height, 14px text</li>
<li>Medium: 44px height, 16px text (default)</li>
<li>Large: 52px height, 18px text</li>
</ul>
<h4>Rules</h4>
<ul>
<li>Always include visible focus indicator</li>
<li>Minimum 44x44px touch target</li>
<li>Use loading state for async actions</li>
<li>Include icon + text for important actions</li>
</ul>
<h3>Cards</h3>
<h4>Property Cards</h4>
<ul>
<li>Image with lazy loading</li>
<li>Title (H3)</li>
<li>Address</li>
<li>Features (beds, baths, sqft)</li>
<li>Tags (Section 8, HUD-VASH, Pet Friendly)</li>
<li>CTA button</li>
</ul>
<h4>Hover Effects</h4>
<ul>
<li>Subtle lift (translateY -4px)</li>
<li>Shadow increase</li>
<li>Image zoom (scale 1.05)</li>
</ul>
<h3>Forms</h3>
<h4>Input Fields</h4>
<ul>
<li>Clear labels above inputs</li>
<li>Placeholder text for examples only</li>
<li>Error messages below with icon</li>
<li>Success state on valid input</li>
<li>16px minimum font size (prevents iOS zoom)</li>
</ul>
<h4>Validation</h4>
<ul>
<li>Real-time validation on blur</li>
<li>Clear error messages with recovery path</li>
<li>Use aria-live for screen reader announcements</li>
</ul>
<h3>Navigation</h3>
<h4>Header</h4>
<ul>
<li>Sticky on scroll</li>
<li>Glass morphism effect</li>
<li>Mobile hamburger menu at 768px</li>
<li>Skip navigation link</li>
</ul>
<h4>Mobile Menu</h4>
<ul>
<li>Full-screen overlay</li>
<li>Focus trap when open</li>
<li>Close on Escape key</li>
<li>Animate from left</li>
</ul>
<hr>
<h2>Motion Guidelines</h2>
<h3>Duration</h3>
<table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Token</th>
<th>Value</th>
<th>Usage</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>instant</td>
<td>0ms</td>
<td>Immediate feedback</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>fast</td>
<td>150ms</td>
<td>Micro-interactions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>base</td>
<td>250ms</td>
<td>Standard transitions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>slow</td>
<td>350ms</td>
<td>Complex animations</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>slower</td>
<td>500ms</td>
<td>Page transitions</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3>Easing</h3>
<table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Token</th>
<th>Value</th>
<th>Usage</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>easeOut</td>
<td>cubic-bezier(0, 0, 0.2, 1)</td>
<td>Enter animations</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>easeIn</td>
<td>cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 1, 1)</td>
<td>Exit animations</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>easeInOut</td>
<td>cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1)</td>
<td>Move animations</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bounce</td>
<td>cubic-bezier(0.68, -0.55, 0.265, 1.55)</td>
<td>Playful feedback</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3>Reduced Motion</h3>
<p>Always respect <code>prefers-reduced-motion</code>:</p>
<pre><code class="language-css">@media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) {
  * {
    animation-duration: 0.01ms !important;
    transition-duration: 0.01ms !important;
  }
}
</code></pre>
<hr>
<h2>Responsive Design</h2>
<h3>Breakpoints</h3>
<table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Value</th>
<th>Target</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>xs</td>
<td>320px</td>
<td>Small phones</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>sm</td>
<td>640px</td>
<td>Large phones</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>md</td>
<td>768px</td>
<td>Tablets</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>lg</td>
<td>1024px</td>
<td>Laptops</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>xl</td>
<td>1280px</td>
<td>Desktops</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>2xl</td>
<td>1536px</td>
<td>Large screens</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3>Mobile-First Approach</h3>
<p>Write base styles for mobile, then add complexity:</p>
<pre><code class="language-css">/* Mobile (default) */
.grid {
  grid-template-columns: 1fr;
}

/* Tablet */
@media (min-width: 768px) {
  .grid {
    grid-template-columns: repeat(2, 1fr);
  }
}

/* Desktop */
@media (min-width: 1024px) {
  .grid {
    grid-template-columns: repeat(3, 1fr);
  }
}
</code></pre>
<hr>
<h2>Accessibility Checklist</h2>
<h3>Color &amp; Contrast</h3>
<ul>
<li>[ ] Text contrast ratio â‰¥ 4.5:1 (AA)</li>
<li>[ ] Large text contrast ratio â‰¥ 3:1</li>
<li>[ ] Non-text contrast ratio â‰¥ 3:1</li>
<li>[ ] Don't rely on color alone for meaning</li>
</ul>
<h3>Keyboard Navigation</h3>
<ul>
<li>[ ] All interactive elements focusable</li>
<li>[ ] Visible focus indicators</li>
<li>[ ] Logical tab order</li>
<li>[ ] Skip navigation link</li>
<li>[ ] Escape closes modals/menus</li>
</ul>
<h3>Screen Readers</h3>
<ul>
<li>[ ] Semantic HTML structure</li>
<li>[ ] Proper heading hierarchy (H1 â†’ H2 â†’ H3)</li>
<li>[ ] Alt text for images</li>
<li>[ ] ARIA labels for icons/buttons</li>
<li>[ ] Live regions for dynamic content</li>
</ul>
<h3>Forms</h3>
<ul>
<li>[ ] Labels associated with inputs</li>
<li>[ ] Error messages linked with aria-describedby</li>
<li>[ ] Required fields marked with aria-required</li>
<li>[ ] Form validation announced</li>
</ul>
<h3>Touch</h3>
<ul>
<li>[ ] 44x44px minimum touch targets</li>
<li>[ ] 8px minimum spacing between targets</li>
<li>[ ] No hover-only interactions</li>
</ul>
<hr>
<h2>File Naming Conventions</h2>
<h3>Images</h3>
<pre><code>[type]-[location]-[description].[ext]
</code></pre>
<p>Examples:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>hero-home-banner.webp</code></li>
<li><code>properties-tyler-ranch-home.webp</code></li>
<li><code>icon-section-8.svg</code></li>
</ul>
<h3>CSS Classes (BEM)</h3>
<pre><code>.block__element--modifier
</code></pre>
<p>Examples:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>.property-card</code></li>
<li><code>.property-card__image</code></li>
<li><code>.property-card--featured</code></li>
</ul>
<h3>JavaScript</h3>
<pre><code>camelCase for variables/functions
PascalCase for classes
UPPER_SNAKE_CASE for constants
</code></pre>

                        <div class="accordion__panel faq-answer" id="faq-6">
                            <p><strong>Yes, every property undergoes comprehensive renovation</strong> before becoming
                                available. Our renovation process includes:</p>
                            <h4>Core Systems (12-month warranties)</h4>
                            <ul>
                                <li>Complete HVAC system replacement and certification</li>
                                <li>Full roof replacement with premium materials</li>
                                <li>New plumbing throughout with copper pipes</li>
                                <li>Modern electrical systems with code compliance</li>
                            </ul>
                            <h4>Interior Finishes (6-month warranties)</h4>
                            <ul>
                                <li>Professional painting throughout</li>
                                <li>New or refinished flooring</li>
                                <li>Updated kitchens with new appliances</li>
                                <li>Modern bathrooms with new fixtures</li>
                                <li>Fresh fixtures and lighting</li>
                            </ul>
                            <p>See our complete <a href="transparency.html" class="gold-link">renovation standards</a>
                                for full details.</p>
                        </div>
                    </div>

                    <div class="accordion__item faq-item">
                        <button class="accordion__button faq-question" type="button" aria-expanded="false"
                            aria-controls="faq-7">
                            <span>How long does the application process take?</span>
                            <span class="accordion__icon" aria-hidden="true">
                                <svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor"
                                    stroke-width="2">
                                    <polyline points="6 9 12 15 18 9" />
                                </svg>
                            </span>
                        </button>
                        <div class="accordion__panel faq-answer" id="faq-7">
                            <p>The timeline varies based on your voucher status and property availability:</p>
                            <h4>For Applicants with Active Vouchers</h4>
                            <ul>
                                <li><strong>Application Review:</strong> 24-48 hours</li>
                                <li><strong>Document Verification:</strong> 1-3 business days</li>
                                <li><strong>Property Viewing:</strong> Same week if approved</li>
                                <li><strong>Lease Signing:</strong> Within 1-2 weeks</li>
                            </ul>
                            <h4>For Applicants Without Vouchers</h4>
                            <ul>
                                <li><strong>Application Review:</strong> 24-48 hours</li>
                                <li><strong>Voucher Guidance:</strong> We'll help connect you with local housing
                                    authorities</li>
                                <li><strong>Timeline:</strong> Depends on housing authority waitlist status</li>
                            </ul>
                            <p>We'll keep you informed throughout the entire process.</p>
                        </div>
                    </div>

                    <div class="accordion__item faq-item">
                        <button class="accordion__button faq-question" type="button" aria-expanded="false"
                            aria-controls="faq-8">
                            <span>What if I don't have a housing voucher yet?</span>
                            <span class="accordion__icon" aria-hidden="true">
                                <svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor"
                                    stroke-width="2">
                                    <polyline points="6 9 12 15 18 9" />
                                </svg>
                            </span>
                        </button>
                        <div class="accordion__panel faq-answer" id="faq-8">
                            <p><strong>We can help guide you through the voucher process.</strong> Here's how we assist
                                applicants without vouchers:</p>
                            <h4>Section 8 Vouchers</h4>
                            <ul>
                                <li>Help you understand eligibility requirements</li>
                                <li>Connect you with local housing authorities</li>
                                <li>Guide you through application processes</li>
                                <li>Monitor waitlist openings</li>
                            </ul>
                            <h4>HUD-VASH for Veterans</h4>
                            <ul>
                                <li>Coordinate with your VA case manager</li>
                                <li>Provide documentation of our veteran-friendly properties</li>
                                <li>Support the voucher application process</li>
                                <li>Expedite property matching once voucher is issued</li>
                            </ul>
                            <p>Contact us to discuss your situation and we'll create a personalized plan.</p>
                        </div>
                    </div>

                    <div class="accordion__item faq-item">
                        <button class="accordion__button faq-question" type="button" aria-expanded="false"
                            aria-controls="faq-9">
                            <span>What are your income requirements?</span>
                            <span class="accordion__icon" aria-hidden="true">
                                <svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor"
                                    stroke-width="2">
                                    <polyline points="6 9 12 15 18 9" />
                                </svg>
                            </span>
                        </button>
                        <div class="accordion__panel faq-answer" id="faq-9">
                            <p>Income requirements vary by program and are set by the housing authorities, but
                                generally:</p>
                            <h4>Section 8 Housing Choice Vouchers</h4>
                            <ul>
                                <li>Typically 50% or below Area Median Income (AMI)</li>
                                <li>For East Texas (2025): Single person maximum â‰ˆ $19,750/year</li>
                                <li>Four-person household maximum â‰ˆ $28,200/year</li>
                            </ul>
                            <h4>HUD-VASH</h4>
                            <ul>
                                <li>Usually 50% or below AMI</li>
                                <li>Special considerations for homeless veterans</li>
                                <li>Case-by-case evaluation for extreme circumstances</li>
                            </ul>
                            <p>We can help you determine if you meet current income requirements for your area.</p>
                        </div>
                    </div>

                    <div class="accordion__item faq-item">
                        <button class="accordion__button faq-question" type="button" aria-expanded="false"

    <script>
      // Check online status
      function updateOnlineStatus() {
        const dot = document.getElementById("status-dot");
        const text = document.getElementById("status-text");

        if (navigator.onLine) {
          dot.classList.add("online");
          text.textContent = "Connection restored! Reloading...";
          setTimeout(() => window.location.reload(), 1500);
        } else {
          dot.classList.remove("online");
          text.textContent = "No internet connection";
        }
      }

      // Listen for online/offline events
      window.addEventListener("online", updateOnlineStatus);
      window.addEventListener("offline", updateOnlineStatus);

      // Initial check
      updateOnlineStatus();

      // Show cached pages
      async function showCachedPages() {
        if ("caches" in window) {
          try {
            const cacheNames = await caches.keys();
            const cachedUrls = new Set();

            for (const cacheName of cacheNames) {
              const cache = await caches.open(cacheName);
              const keys = await cache.keys();

              keys.forEach((request) => {
                const url = new URL(request.url);
                if (url.pathname.endsWith(".html") || url.pathname === "/") {
                  cachedUrls.add(url.pathname);
                }
              });
            }

            if (cachedUrls.size > 0) {
              const container = document.getElementById("cached-pages");
              const list = document.getElementById("cached-list");

              const pageNames = {
                "/": "Home",
                "/index.html": "Home",
                "/properties.html": "Properties",
                "/about.html": "About Us",
                "/contact.html": "Contact",
                "/apply.html": "Apply",
                "/resources.html": "Resources",
                "/faq.html": "FAQ",
                "/impact.html": "Our Impact",
                "/transparency.html": "Transparency",
              };

              cachedUrls.forEach((url) => {
                const name =
                  pageNames[url] || url.replace(".html", "").replace("/", "");
                if (name && url !== "/offline.html") {
                  const li = document.createElement("li");
                  li.innerHTML = `<a href="${url}">${name}</a>`;
                  list.appendChild(li);
                }
              });

              if (list.children.length > 0) {
                container.style.display = "block";
              }
            }
          } catch (error) {
            console.error("Error checking cached pages:", error);
          }
        }
      }

      showCachedPages();
    </script>
  </body>
</html>

        <section class="page-banner"
            style="background-image: url('/images/banners/hero-privacy-banner.webp'); background-size: cover; background-position: center;">
            <div class="container">
                <h1>Privacy Policy</h1>
                <p>How we protect and use your personal information</p>
            </div>
        </section>

        <!-- PRIVACY CONTENT -->
        <section class="privacy-container container">
            <div class="resources-header">
                <p class="last-updated"><strong>Last Updated: December 14, 2025</strong></p>
            </div>

            <div class="privacy-content">
                <div class="privacy-section">
                    <h2>Overview</h2>
                    <p>Properties 4 Creations ("we," "our," or "us") is committed to protecting the privacy and security
                        of your personal information. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and
                        safeguard your information when you use our website, apply for housing, or interact with our
                        services.</p>
                    <p>We are a veteran-owned housing provider specializing in premium, renovated homes for veterans and
                        families in East Texas. We comply with all applicable privacy laws and regulations, including
                        the Fair Housing Act and Texas privacy laws.</p>
                </div>

                <div class="privacy-section">
                    <h2>Information We Collect</h2>

                    <h3>Personal Information</h3>
                    <p>We may collect the following types of personal information:</p>
                    <ul>
                        <li><strong>Contact Information:</strong> Name, phone number, email address, mailing address
                        </li>
                        <li><strong>Demographic Information:</strong> Date of birth, household size, income information
                        </li>
                        <li><strong>Housing Information:</strong> Housing assistance program participation, voucher
                            details</li>
                        <li><strong>Military Service Information:</strong> Branch of service, discharge status (for
                            veteran applicants)</li>
                        <li><strong>Housing Preferences:</strong> Preferred property types, accessibility needs, move-in
                            timeline</li>
                        <li><strong>Communication Records:</strong> Messages, questions, and feedback you send to us
                        </li>
                    </ul>

                    <h3>Automatically Collected Information</h3>
                    <p>When you visit our website, we may automatically collect:</p>
                    <ul>
                        <li><strong>Usage Data:</strong> Pages visited, time spent on pages, click patterns</li>
                        <li><strong>Technical Data:</strong> IP address, browser type, operating system, device type
                        </li>
                        <li><strong>Analytics:</strong> Google Analytics data for website improvement</li>
                    </ul>
                </div>

                <div class="privacy-section">
                    <h2>How We Use Your Information</h2>
                    <p>We use collected information for the following purposes:</p>

                    <h3>Housing Services</h3>
                    <ul>
                        <li>Process housing applications and determine eligibility</li>
                        <li>Verify income and voucher information with housing authorities</li>
                        <li>Match applicants with suitable properties</li>
                        <li>Manage lease agreements and property assignments</li>
                        <li>Coordinate move-in processes and property showings</li>
                    </ul>

                    <h3>Communication</h3>
                    <ul>
                        <li>Respond to inquiries and provide customer support</li>
                        <li>Send important updates about applications and properties</li>
                        <li>Provide information about housing programs and resources</li>
                        <li>Share transparency reports and property information</li>
                    </ul>

                    <h3>Legal Compliance</h3>
                    <ul>
                        <li>Comply with Fair Housing laws and anti-discrimination requirements</li>
                        <li>Meet reporting requirements for housing programs</li>
                        <li>Maintain accurate records for landlord-tenant relationships</li>
                        <li>Protect against fraud and ensure tenant safety</li>
                    </ul>

                    <h3>Website Improvement</h3>
                    <ul>
                        <li>Analyze website usage to improve user experience</li>
                        <li>Debug technical issues and ensure site functionality</li>
                        <li>Personalize content based on housing interests</li>
                    </ul>
                </div>

                <div class="privacy-section">
                    <h2>Information Sharing and Disclosure</h2>
                    <p>We do not sell, trade, or rent your personal information to third parties. We may share
                        information only in the following circumstances:</p>

                    <h3>Housing Program Verification</h3>
                    <ul>
                        <li><strong>HUD and VA:</strong> Verify voucher status and eligibility with HUD-VASH
                            coordinators or VA representatives</li>
                        <li><strong>Public Housing Authorities:</strong> Confirm Section 8 voucher validity and
                            compliance</li>
                        <li><strong>Background Check Providers:</strong> Conduct tenant screening for safety and
                            compliance</li>
                    </ul>

                    <h3>Legal Requirements</h3>
                    <ul>
                        <li>Respond to subpoenas, court orders, or legal requirements</li>
                        <li>Report suspected fraud, criminal activity, or safety threats</li>
                        <li>Comply with government housing program audits and reporting</li>
                    </ul>

                    <h3>Service Providers</h3>
                    <ul>
                        <li>Property management software providers (with data protection agreements)</li>
                        <li>Professional services (legal, accounting) under confidentiality agreements</li>
                        <li>Website hosting and maintenance providers</li>
                    </ul>
                </div>

                <div class="privacy-section">
                    <h2>Data Security</h2>
                    <p>We implement appropriate technical, administrative, and physical security measures to protect
                        your personal information:</p>

                    <h3>Technical Protections</h3>
                    <ul>
                        <li>SSL/TLS encryption for data transmission</li>
                        <li>Secure data storage with access controls</li>
                        <li>Regular security audits and updates</li>
                        <li>Multi-factor authentication for staff access</li>
                    </ul>

                    <h3>Administrative Protections</h3>
                    <ul>
                        <li>Limited access to personal information on need-to-know basis</li>
                        <li>Staff training on privacy and security procedures</li>
                        <li>Regular security awareness programs</li>
                        <li>Incident response and breach notification procedures</li>
                    </ul>

                    <h3>Physical Protections</h3>
                    <ul>
                        <li>Secure office facilities with access controls</li>
                        <li>Document storage in locked cabinets</li>
                        <li>Secure disposal of physical records</li>
                    </ul>
                </div>

                <div class="privacy-section">
                    <h2>Your Rights and Choices</h2>

                    <h3>Access and Correction</h3>
                    <p>You have the right to:</p>
                    <ul>
                        <li>Request access to your personal information we maintain</li>
                        <li>Request correction of inaccurate or incomplete information</li>
                        <li>Receive a copy of your information in a portable format</li>
                    </ul>

                    <h3>Communication Preferences</h3>
                    <p>You may:</p>
                    <ul>
                        <li>Opt out of marketing communications (though we rarely send these)</li>
                        <li>Choose how you wish to be contacted for application updates</li>
                        <li>Update your contact information at any time</li>
                    </ul>

                    <h3>Data Deletion</h3>
                    <p>You can request deletion of your information, though we may retain certain information as
                        required by law or for legitimate business purposes, such as:</p>
                    <ul>
                        <li>Completed lease records (for legal compliance)</li>
                        <li>Financial records (for tax and accounting purposes)</li>
                        <li>Communications about safety or legal matters</li>
                    </ul>
                </div>

                <div class="privacy-section">
                    <h2>Cookies and Tracking</h2>
                    <p>Our website uses cookies and similar technologies:</p>

                    <h3>Essential Cookies</h3>
                    <ul>
                        <li>Remember your session and security preferences</li>
                        <li>Enable website functionality and navigation</li>
                        <li>Process applications and forms</li>
                    </ul>

                    <h3>Analytics Cookies</h3>
                    <ul>
                        <li>Google Analytics to understand website usage</li>
                        <li>Help improve user experience</li>
                        <li>Identify technical issues</li>
                    </ul>

                    <p>You can manage cookie preferences through your browser settings, though disabling essential
                        cookies may affect website functionality.</p>
                </div>

                <div class="privacy-section">
                    <h2>Children's Privacy</h2>
                    <p>Our services are intended for adults 18 years and older. We do not knowingly collect personal
                        information from children under 18. If we become aware that we have collected information from a
                        child, we will delete it immediately.</p>
                </div>

                <div class="privacy-section">
                    <h2>Changes to This Policy</h2>
                    <p>We may update this Privacy Policy periodically to reflect changes in our practices or applicable
                        laws. We will:</p>
                    <ul>
                        <li>Post the updated policy on our website</li>
                        <li>Update the "Last Updated" date above</li>
                        <li>Notify you of significant changes via email or website notice</li>
                        <li>Continue to respect the privacy choices you've made</li>
                    </ul>
                </div>

                <div class="privacy-section">
                    <h2>Contact Us About Privacy</h2>
                    <p>If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us:</p>

                    <div class="contact-methods">
                        <p><strong>Properties 4 Creations</strong><br>
                            Privacy Officer<br>
                            Tyler, Texas</p>

                        <p><strong>Email:</strong> privacy@properties4creations.com<br>
                            <strong>Phone:</strong> (903) 555-1234
                        </p>
                    </div>

                    <p>Response Time: We respond to privacy inquiries within 48 hours.</p>
                </div>

                <div class="privacy-section">
                    <h2>Complaints and Dispute Resolution</h2>
                    <p>If you believe your privacy rights have been violated:</p>
                    <ul>
                        <li>Contact us directly first for resolution</li>
                        <li>File a complaint with the Texas Attorney General's Office</li>
                        <li>Report housing discrimination to HUD (fairhousing@HUD.gov)</li>
                        <li>Contact appropriate state or federal regulatory agencies</li>
                    </ul>
                </div>
            </div>

            navMenu.classList.toggle('active');
            menuToggle.classList.toggle('active');
        });

        navLinks.forEach(link => {
            link.addEventListener('click', () => {
                navMenu.classList.remove('active');
                menuToggle.classList.remove('active');
            });
        });

        // PROPERTIES DATA WITH REAL IMAGES
